intro: Manotes brevistyla, commonly known as the short-styled manotes, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Manotes brevistyla is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or stream banks.
